content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 7 to node 11 in the provided graph is:

7 -> 8 -> 11

Note that this is the shortest path that includes node 8, which is the node between nodes 7 and 11. If you change the destination to any other node along the path, the shortest path will change accordingly.

The shortest path from node 7 to node 8 in the provided graph is:

7 -> 8

Note that this is the shortest path that includes node 8, which is the node directly connected to node 7 and node 9. If you change the destination to any other node along the path, the shortest path will change accordingly.
